Detailed Description

Miscellaneous math related functions: Rounding, minimum and maximum, angles, sorting, random numbers, and differentiation.

Function Documentation

Rounds a double.

int cvl_reflect (  int  c,
int  bound
) 
 

Parameters:
c The coordinate that should be reflected if necessary.
bound The upper bound of the coordinate + 1 (in most cases width or height).
Returns the coordinate with reflective indexing applied. Every value of c can be mapped into [0,bound-1] in this way.

int  b
) 
 

Parameters:
a The first factor.
b The second factor.
Returns:
Whether the product fits into an int.
Checks if the product of two ints fits into an int. Used to prevent arithmetic overflows.

size_t  a_len
) 
 

Parameters:
a The array.
a_len The length of the array.
Sorts an array of ints. This is just a convenient wrapper around qsort.

void cvl_sort_array_double (  double *  a,
size_t  a_len
) 
 

Parameters:
a The array.
a_len The length of the array.
Sorts an array of doubles. This is just a convenient wrapper around qsort.

void cvl_rng_init (  unsigned long int  seed  ) 
 

Parameters:
seed The seed value.
Seeds the GSL random number generator (after initializing it if necessary). The special seed 0 disabled seeding of the RNG; this function then just makes sure that the RNG is initialized. This initialization seeds the RNG with a default value which can be changed by setting the environment variable GSL_RNG_SEED. See http://www.gnu.org/software/gsl/manual/gsl-ref_17.html#SEC268.
